translations: 使分化为不同的看法（ polarise 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.sentence: In fact, the polarised debate over public health interventions should have been abandoned long ago.
sentences.translation: 事实上，关于公共卫生干预的两极化争论早就应该被摒弃了。

sentences.sentence: When public opinion is particularly polarised, as it was following the end of the Franco regime, monarchs can rise above "mere" politics and "embody" a spirit of national unity.
sentences.translation: 当公众舆论两极分化时，就像佛朗哥政权结束后那样，君主可以超越“纯粹的”政治，成为国家统一的精神“象征”。
